intro: Hieracium chabertii, commonly known as Chabert's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring well-drained conditions. It produces yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem. Hieracium chabertii is often found in temperate regions and can be a common sight in open, sunny habitats.
